intro: Triumfetta velutina, commonly known as velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its hairy, velvety leaves and showy yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in both wet and dry conditions. Triumfetta velutina is sometimes considered a weed due to its rapid growth and ability to spread easily.
